key_channel_insights.line_content: Around 94% of OTA fares are higher, indicating a persistent price premium.
About 76% of fares match, underscoring strong alignment with the official site.
In roughly 96–98% of cases, GDS pricing exceeds direct fares.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Approximately 94% of itineraries price higher on the OTA, indicating a consistent premium over the airline’s own site.
Only about 2–3% of fares appear lower on the OTA, reflecting a niche price advantage.
OTA-unavailable offers hover near 3%, with minor weekly or monthly fluctuations.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Stays around 3% overall, showing modest increases from both last week and last month.
No identical fares observed, indicating consistent differentials.
Represents about 2–3%, with a slight upward trend from prior periods.
Dominates at roughly 94%. Recent marginal declines suggest a slightly narrowed premium.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Mirrors the overall pattern: OTA is higher in over 90% of cases, with lower fares remaining minimal.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA pricing higher in about 94% of fares, unavailability around 2–4%, and lower fares below 4%.
Also near 94% higher on OTA, with unavailability at about 3% and lower fares near 2%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Higher fares at 92–93%, about 3% lower-fare frequency, and a stable 4% unavailability.
OTA-higher reaches 97%, undercuts under 2%, and minimal unavailable inventory.

mse_highlights.line_content: Around 76% of MSE fares match the website, reinforcing strong pricing parity.
Channel-lower rates decreased slightly this week to about 19.9%, continuing a downward trend.
No recorded cases of fares higher than the direct website, reflecting minimal MSE markups.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Rose 1.3% but remains under 4%, indicating a small coverage gap.
Dominant at about three-quarters of fares, dipping 1% week over week.
Near 20% this week, falling from last month’s 29.8%, indicating fewer discounts.
None recorded, showing no channel-over list fares.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Matches the overall statistics: about 76% parity, roughly 19% cheaper, and no overpricing.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Same fare share reaches 87%, cheaper fares 12.6%, reflecting a mild drop week over week.
66% parity with a 27% channel-lower share, showing a higher incidence of discounts.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 73% match the direct fare, with 23% cheaper, down 2.4 percentage points vs last week.
80% parity, and 16% discounted, up 4.5% from the previous week.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS channel prices are 96–98% higher than the direct website across all segments.
Matching fares are nearly nonexistent, indicating negligible pricing parity.
GDS-lower remains under 4%, with slight incremental growth in some origin markets.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Stays below 1% in most segments, with minor spikes in RS markets.
Virtually 0% across the board, reflecting no meaningful parity.
Dominates at 96–98%. A small decline vs last week, with a slight price premium change.
2–3% share overall. Has gained modest traction, especially in non-RS routes.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Over 97% GDS-higher, with minimal variation from previous periods.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: About 95% GDS-higher, slightly down. GDS-lower remains under 4%.
Retains around 97% GDS-higher. GDS-lower rose marginally to about 3% last week.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Maintains a 98.6% higher frequency, with under 2% GDS-lower.
